item.title: About
item.description: DataScribe is a project of the Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media at George Mason University. Project Team Ken Albers Developer Megan Brett Outreach Coordinator Daniel Howlett Graduate Research Assistant Lincoln Mullen Co-Director Kim Nguyen Designer Jessica Otis Co-Director Jim Safley Developer Advisory Board Kalani Craig Sharon Leon Jeff McClurken Luca Scholz Funders DataScribe has been made possible in part by a major grant from the National Endowment for the Humanities.

item.title: Get Started
item.description: In order to start working with DataScribe, you will need: to have a plan for how you want to sort your content into datasets; to have a plan for how you want to build the forms for your data and datasets; to add your historical data sources into Omeka as as items and item sets. Thinking about data Things you need to decide: How many forms do you want to build?
